intro: Malapoenna pulchella, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. It is adapted to dry conditions and displays a compact, shrub-like form. Malapoenna pulchella is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
